types.apps: Items of this type are applications that are intentionally created to be Vim-like in some respect (possibly disabled by default). Less Vim-like applications are in "Configurable" section.
types.plugs: Items of this type are plugins for applications that make them behave Vim-like to various extent.
types.confs: Items of this type have bindings that are either already similar or configurable to resemble Vim-like behaviour to a degree.

items.name: Cream-Browser
items.descr: A Vim-like lightweight Web browser with [Vimperator] interface.

items.name: dwb
items.descr: Quite nicely done Vim-like browser, modulo some issues with memory.

items.name: jumanji
items.descr: The idea behind jumanji is a Web browser that provides a minimalistic and space saving interface as well as an easy usage that mainly focuses on keyboard interaction like [Vimperator] does.

items.name: luakit
items.descr: Fast, small, WebKit based browser framework extensible by Lua.

items.name: next
items.descr: A keyboard-oriented, extensible web-browser designed for power users.
items.ui: WebKit or WebEngine/Blink, Qt or GTK+

items.name: qutebrowser
items.descr: Qutebrowser is a keyboard-focused browser with a minimal GUI.

items.name: surf
items.descr: Ultra-minimalistic Web browser.

items.name: Uzbl
items.descr: Web interface tools which adhere to the unix philosophy.

items.name: Vimprobable
items.descr: A lean stand-alone web browser optimised for full keyboard control (inspired by [Vimperator]).
comments: didn't have history and cookies (claimed that this is for security)

items.name: vimb
items.descr: Vim-like browser based on the WebKit engine and the GTK toolkit.

items.name: wyeb
items.descr: A vim-like webkit2gtk web browser.

items.name: xombrero
items.descr: A minimalist's Web browser, which strives to be Vim-like for heavy keyboard users while maintaining traditional Web browser behavior.

items.name: Vieb
items.descr: Vim Inspired Electron Browser - Vim bindings for the web by design.

items.name: lynx
items.descr: Text Web browser.

items.name: Netrik
items.descr: A simplistic text mode (character cell display) Web browser, similar to w3m or Lynx.

items.name: w3m
items.descr: w3m is a text-based Web browser as well as a pager like more or [less].

items.name: aerc
items.descr: Highly efficient and extensible terminal email client.

items.name: meli
items.descr: Experimental terminal mail client aiming for configurability and extensibility with sane defaults.

items.name: Mutt
items.descr: Mutt is a small but very powerful text-based mail client for Unix operating systems.

items.name: NeoMutt
items.descr: A fork of [mutt], intendted to reignite the development.

items.name: notmuch
items.descr: E-mail indexer/framework, which provides plugin for Vim.

items.name: sup
items.descr: A console-based e-mail client for people with a lot of e-mail.

items.name: wyrd
items.descr: A text-based front-end to [remind](https://dianne.skoll.ca/projects/remind/), a sophisticated calendar and alarm program.

items.name: Amp
items.descr: A complete text editor for your terminal.
comments: Makes one think of things like Sublime and SpaceVim.

items.name: bvi
items.descr: A display-oriented editor for binary files (hex editor).

items.name: bvi plus
items.descr: Fork of [bvi] hex editor with more features.

items.name: hed
items.descr: HED is a wannabe-powerful visual hexadecimal editor with focus on fast editing of very large files.

items.name: HEdit
items.descr: A Vim-like terminal-based hex editor scriptable with JS.
comments: it seems to be possible to build it without JS

items.name: hexer
items.descr: A multi-buffer editor for viewing and manipulating binary files.

items.name: hx
items.descr: Hex editor for the terminal using plain C99 + POSIX libs.

items.name: elvis
items.descr: A free Vi clone for Unix and other operating systems.

items.name: ex-vi
items.descr: The traditional vi editor, ported to modern Unix systems.
comments: url points to updated version of <http://ex-vi.sourceforge.net/>

items.name: Kakoune
items.descr: Interactive only editor inspired by Vim.
comments: not really Vim-like judging by examples in the Readme

items.name: neovim
items.descr: Fork of Vim.
comments: has several incompatibilities with Vim (like dropped command-line options, no interactivity on `:!`, see <https://neovim.io/doc/user/vim_diff.html>)
GUI is implemented in separate projects: <https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Related-projects#gui>

items.name: nvi
items.descr: Vi reimplementation.

items.name: nvi
items.descr: Very opinionated Node.JS VI clone.

items.name: Onivim 2
items.descr: Sublime/VSCode-like editor internally backed by Vim's code.

items.name: pyvim
items.descr: Pure Python Vim clone.
comments: not sure how Vim-like it is

items.name: rim
items.descr: Aspiring Vim-like text editor.

items.name: spacemacs
items.descr: An Emacs-based editor that draws heavily from Vim keybindings.

items.name: vile
items.descr: Vi clone with multiple buffers and similar features from Emacs added.

items.name: Vim
items.descr: The ubiquitous text editor.

items.name: vis
items.descr: A Vim-like editor based on Plan 9's structural regular expressions.
comments: if I get it right, it's not really that Vim-like (e.g. lots of Lua is used) and is deliberately handicapped compared to Vim

items.name: vy
items.descr: A Vim-like modal editor in python made from scratch.

items.name: WinVi
items.descr: Vim-like text and hex editor, which also tries to be Notepad compatible.

items.name: xvi
items.descr: The smallest full-function Vi text editor clone.

items.name: Yzis
items.descr: A Vi/Vim engine that can be integrated in graphical applications.

items.name: moe
items.descr: A command line based editor inspired by vi/vim.  Written in Nim.

items.name: jvifm
items.descr: An attempt to implement graphical Vim-like file manager in Java.

items.name: lf
items.descr: Terminal file manager, which is a clone of [ranger].

items.name: ranger
items.descr: A console file manager with Vi key bindings, includes application association guessing tool.

items.name: Vide
items.descr: A graphical predecessor of [vifm].
comments: see `buildable-version` branch and supply `CFLAGS=-std=gnu90` on modern GCC (C99 semantics of inline conflicts with GTK+1) if you want to try it out

items.name: vifm
items.descr: File manager with Vim-like keybindings/modes/options/commands/configuration, which also borrows some useful ideas from mutt.

items.name: cmus
items.descr: Not so minimalistic terminal player.

items.name: herrie
items.descr: Minimalistic player with curses interface.
comments: uses mplayer to play the music
project has been abandoned by the original author

items.name: pms
items.descr: Probably the most Vim-like music player (MPD client).
comments: is in constant rewrite process sometimes with very long pauses
the database is presented as one long list

items.name: Siren
items.descr: A text-based audio player for Unix-like operating systems, inspired by cmus.

items.name: vimpc
items.descr: Client for mpd with Vim-like key bindings.

items.name: vimus
items.descr: Terminal MPD client with Vim-like key bindings.

items.name: vitunes
items.descr: Console playlist/music database manager with Vim-like bindings.
comments: uses mplayer to play the music

items.name: apvlv
items.descr: A PDF/DJVU/UMD/TXT viewer under Linux/WIN32, which tries to behave like Vim.
comments: remember it being kinda raw, but usable

items.name: zathura
items.descr: A document viewer with plugin system.
comments: had troubles installing newer version, so using the old one
search used to be one match at a time, later was changed to whole-document search, which is very slow on huge documents

items.name: jV
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.descr: Plugin for Firefox, Pale Moon, Basilisk.

items.name: Tridactyl
items.descr: Plugin for Firefox.

items.descr: Embed Neovim in Chrome, Firefox & others.

items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near [Vimperator]/[Pentadactyl]

items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.

comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near [Vimperator]/[Pentadactyl]

comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near [Vimperator]/[Pentadactyl]

comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near [Vimperator]/[Pentadactyl]

items.descr: Plugin for Chrome and Chromium.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near [Vimperator]/[Pentadactyl]

items.name: vimary
items.descr: A Safari extension that provides vim style keyboard based navigation.

items.name: VimOperate
items.descr: Plugin for Opera.
comments: if I get it right, it's nowhere near [Vimperator]/[Pentadactyl]

items.name: wasavi
items.descr: An extension for Chrome, Opera and Firefox that transforms textarea element of any page into a VI editor.

items.name: Krabby
items.descr: A keyboard interface to the web, inspired by Kakoune.
comments: Crystal there is for the native part.

items.name: Saka Key
items.descr: A browser extension that lets you map keys on your keyboard to common browser tasks.
comments: Initial mappings aren't exactly as in Vim, but they seem to be configurable.

items.name: Eclim
items.descr: Two-way integration between Eclipse IDE and Vim.

items.name: ExEdit

items.name: Viable
items.descr: Plugin for Eclipse IDE.

items.name: viPlugin
items.descr: Plugin for Eclipse IDE.

items.name: vimplugin
items.descr: An attempt to use the Vim editor inside the Eclipse IDE.

items.name: vrapper
items.descr: Plugin for Eclipse IDE that supposedly preserves original keybindings.

items.name: Vimpulse
items.descr: Emulates Vim's most useful features.

items.name: eVil
items.descr: The extensible vi layer for Emacs.

items.name: Viper
items.descr: Emacs mode that emulates vi key bindings.

items.name: Vim Mode
items.descr: An implementation of Vi and Vim-like key bindings for Emacs.

items.name: CubicleVim
items.descr: A COM Add-In to allow editing Microsoft Outlook messages.

items.name: DrRacket Vim Tool
items.descr: Adds vim-like editing to DrRacket.

items.name: FakeVim
items.descr: Standard QtCreator plugin (the link is to the widget).
comments: has quite good implementation compared to many others, although some things are missing

items.name: IDEAVim

comments: This plugin exist for all Jetbrain's IDEs including IntelliJ, PyCharm, PHPStorm, WebStorm...

items.descr: Provides Vim modal control for [Inkdrop](https://inkdrop.app/), blending the best of Vim and Inkdrop.

items.descr: An [Irssi](https://irssi.org/) script to emulate some of the vi(m) features for the Irssi inputline.

items.name: jVi

comments: one of the closest Vim-like emulation plugins, among those I've ever tried

items.name: viemu

comments: tried it for Visual Studio, it wasn't bad, but it left me unimpressed (quite long time ago)

items.name: viex
items.descr: NetBeans IDE Vim-like plugin.

items.name: Vintage
items.descr: Vim-like plugin for Sublime Text.

items.name: VintageEx
items.descr: A rendition of Vim's command-line mode for Sublime Text 2.

items.name: Vintageous
items.descr: Vintageous is a comprehensive vi/Vim emulation layer for Sublime Text 3.
comments: README says that Vintageous has been discontinued and its successor is Sublime Six (not open source)

items.name: Vim Mode
items.descr: Plugin for Atom.

items.name: VimNavigation
items.descr: fman plugin for Vim key style navigation.

items.name: ViTunes
items.descr: A Vim plugin that allows you to control iTunes.

items.name: VSCodeVim
items.descr: A Vim emulator for Visual Studio Code.

items.name: VsVim
items.descr: Vim emulation layer for Visual Studio.

items.name: XVim
items.descr: Xcode plugin for Vim keybindings.

items.name: zsh-vi-mode
items.descr: A better and friendlier vi(m) mode plugin for [zsh].

items.name: athame
items.descr: Full vim for your shell ([bash], [zsh], gdb, python, etc).
comments: integrates into applications that provide command-line input and runs Vim in background to do the work.

items.name: Blender
items.descr: Blender is the free and open source 3D creation suite.

items.name: Bombadillo
items.descr: A non-web browser, designed for a growing list of protocols operating outside of the web.

items.name: cgdb
items.descr: Console front-end to the GNU debugger.

items.name: cointop
items.descr: A fast and lightweight interactive terminal based UI application for tracking and monitoring cryptocurrency coin stats in real-time.

items.name: less
items.descr: Its controls are Vim-like.

items.name: Kommand
items.descr: AutoHotKey script, which provides cross-application Vim-like hot key solution.

items.name: ncdu
items.descr: Disk usage browser.

items.name: Snipline
items.descr: A developer tool for organizing shell commands.

items.name: stig
items.descr: TUI and CLI for the BitTorrent client Transmission.
comments:
Works mostly like vim out of the box, but can be enhanced by putting in your `~/.config/tig/config`:
```
bind generic <Ctrl-f>   scroll-page-down
bind generic <Ctrl-b>   scroll-page-up
bind generic g move-first-line			# Move cursor to top.
bind generic G move-last-line			# Move cursor to bottom.

bind main B :toggle commit-title-graph		# Rebind G to B.
bind main G move-last-line			# Move cursor to bottom.
```

items.name: newsbeuter
items.descr: The [Mutt] of RSS feed readers.

items.name: Newsboat
items.descr: An RSS/Atom feed reader for the text console (a fork of Newsbeuter).

items.name: PIDA
items.descr: An IDE that allows integration of Vim/Emacs as editor.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: pineapple-tracker
items.descr: A console-based sequencer with a vi-style UI.

items.name: pipedial
items.descr: One more tool for selecting something in console.

items.name: PyRadio
items.descr: A console based Internet radio player that uses players as back-end.

items.name: sc
items.descr: Terminal spreadsheet editor.

items.descr: Improved version of [sc].

items.name: scli
items.descr: A simple terminal user interface for signal messenger (using signal-cli).

items.name: sentaku
items.descr: Utility to make selection window with shell command.

items.name: Termite
items.descr: A keyboard-centric terminal.

items.name: tig
items.descr: Text-mode interface for [git].

items.name: Taskell
items.descr: Command-line Kanban board/task manager with support for Trello boards and GitHub projects.

items.descr: Vim-like TODO manager.

items.descr: Visual Interactive Taskwarrior full-screen terminal interface.

items.descr: Vim-like jabber client.

items.name: ViPaint
items.descr: A modal, Vim-like painting program.

items.name: vlrtt
items.descr: Vim-like real-time tactics game.

items.name: Termshark
items.descr: A terminal UI for tshark, inspired by Wireshark.

items.name: rx
items.descr: Modern and minimalist pixel editor.

items.name: VNote
items.descr: A Vim-inspired note-taking application, which can also be used as Markdown editor.

items.name: GNU Screen
items.descr: This terminal multiplexer can be configured to use some Vim-like keys, it also has command-line mode.
comments: Screen has command classes, which allow implementing modes: <https://github.com/xaizek/dotfiles/blob/496c12983935288b4308fa1bb078db3c7a75c663/screenrc#L175-L192>

items.name: tmux
items.descr: This terminal multiplexer can be configured to use some Vim-like keys, it also has command-line mode.
comments:
Specifically, a good start is to set in your `tmux.conf`:
```ini
set-option -g status-keys vi	# Use Vi bindings in tmux command prompt.
set-window-option -g mode-keys vi	# Use Vi bindings in copy and choice mode.
```

items.name: Editra
items.descr: Editra is a multi-platform text editor with an implementation that focuses on creating an easy to use interface and features that aid in code development.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: SlickEdit
items.descr: A true cross-platform, multi-language code editor, with support for over 60 languages on 9 platforms.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: Kate
items.descr: The KDE Advanced Text Editor (Kate).
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: AbiWord
items.descr: AbiWord is a free word processing program similar to Microsoft Word. It is suitable for a wide variety of word processing tasks.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: bash
items.descr: An sh-compatible shell that incorporates useful features from the Korn shell (ksh) and C shell (csh).
comments: you can see current mode by adding `set show-mode-in-prompt On` to `~/.inputrc`

items.name: fish
items.descr: Non-POSIX interactive shell mostly preconfigured for the user.

items.name: zsh
items.descr: An extended Bourne shell with a large number of improvements, including some features of [bash], ksh, and tcsh.

items.name: tcsh
items.descr: A modern version of the C shell.

items.name: KornSHell
items.descr: An early UNIX shell.

items.name: GNU ReadLine
items.descr: The library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in.
comments: add `set editing-mode vi` to `~/.inputrc` to enables Vim-like mode in all applications that use readline

items.name: MonoDevelop
items.descr: Cross platform IDE for C#, F# and more.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: GNOME Builder
items.descr: A toolsmith for GNOME-based applications.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: Komodo Edit
items.descr: Komodo Edit is a free text editor for dynamic programming languages.
items.category: IDEs, Word Processors, Editors with Vi-modes

items.name: feh
items.descr: An X11 image viewer aimed mostly at console users.
comments: bindings can be configured to be like in Vi

items.name: imv
items.descr: A command line image viewer intended for use with tiling window managers.

items.name: pim
items.descr: Python image viewer with Vim-like keybindings.

items.name: sxiv
items.descr: Simple X Image Viewer.
comments: some bindings are like in Vi

items.name: vimiv
items.descr: An image viewer with Vim-like keybindings (GTK version).
comments: This version is deprecated in favour of [vimiv-qt].

items.name: vimiv-qt
items.descr: An image viewer with Vim-like keybindings (Qt version).

items.name: xzgv
items.descr: Image viewer with at least j/k mapped.

items.name: Evince
items.descr: A document viewer for multiple document formats.
languages: C and a bit of C++

items.name: MuPDF
items.descr: A lightweight PDF and XPS viewer.

items.name: Okular
items.descr: A universal document viewer developed by KDE.

items.name: AppGrid
items.descr: macOS window manager with Vimlike hotkeys.

items.name: bspwm
items.descr: A tiling window manager based on binary space partitioning.

items.name: euclid
items.descr: Window manager with kind of Vim-like default mappings.

items.name: howm
items.descr: A lightweight, X11 tiling window manager that is promises to behave like Vim (objects/motions/count).
comments: tries to follow Unix-way too much (see next comment)
I used the word "promises" in the description because howm demonstrated severe issues with input processing when I gave it a try, drawing it useless

items.name: i3
items.descr: Tiling WM.
comments: it seems to be possible to define Vim-like modes and there are some predefined ones

items.name: sway
items.descr: An i3-compatible Wayland compositor.

items.name: wmii
items.descr: A small, scriptable window manager, with a 9P filesystem interface and an acme-like layout.
comments: has basic Vi bindings by default

items.name: rexima
items.descr: Vim-like audio-mixer alternative to alsamixer.

items.name: PAmix
items.descr: ncurses/curses pulseaudio mixer in C++ similar to pavucontrol.

items.name: Astroid
items.descr: A keyboard-driven GUI frontend for the notmuch email indexer.

items.name: lnav
items.descr: An advanced terminal log file viewer for the small-scale.

items.name: calcurse
items.descr: Terminal calendar and scheduling application with some Vim-like keys by default.

items.name: cfiles
items.descr: An ncurses file manager written in C with vim like keybindings.  It aims to provide an interface like [ranger] while being lightweight, fast and minimal.

items.name: nnn
items.descr: A tiny full-featured terminal file manager.

items.name: hunter
items.descr: ranger-like file browser, but a little more Emacs-flavoured.

items.name: noice
items.descr: Small file browser.
comments: try this for code (original link doesn't work): <https://github.com/chrisw310/noice>

items.name: rover
items.descr: A small file browser that aims to be simple, fast and portable.

items.name: CopyQ
items.descr: Clipboard manager with advanced features, which claims "support for simple Vim-like editor and shortcuts".

items.name: ncmpc
items.descr: MPD client, which is somewhat Vim-like.

items.name: ncmpcpp
items.descr: MPD client, which is somewhat Vim-like.
comments:
The navigation can quite easily be made to behave like vim with some keyboard configurations in `~/.config/ncmpcpp/bindings`:
```
def_key "j"
  scroll_down
def_key "k"
  scroll_up
def_key "h"
  previous_column
def_key "l"
  next_column
def_key "ctrl-b"
  page_up
def_key "ctrl-u"
  page_up
def_key "ctrl-f"
  page_down
def_key "ctrl-d"
  page_down
def_key "g"
  move_home
def_key "G"
  move_end
def_key "n"
  next_found_item
def_key "N"
  previous_found_item
```

items.name: NetHack
items.descr: Rougue-like game with h/j/k/l.

items.name: rekonq
items.descr: A Web browser for KDE based on WebKit.  Has basic Vim-like keys.

items.name: rtv
items.descr: Reddit terminal viewer provides a text-based interface to view and interact with reddit.

items.name: urxvt
items.descr: Fork of rxvt terminal emulator that adds Unicode support.
comments: looks like it's possible to make it somewhat Vim-like: <https://github.com/ervandew/urxvt-vim-scrollback>

items.name: VisiData
items.descr: An interactive terminal multitool for tabular data.

items.name: WeeChat
items.descr: The extensible IRC client.
comments: bindings can be configured to be like in Vi

items.name: xpdf
items.descr: Xpdf is a free PDF viewer and toolkit, including a text extractor, image converter, HTML converter, and more. Most of the tools are available as open source.
comments: Can be configured to be somewhat Vim-like: <http://stackoverflow.com/a/11241095>

items.name: rtorrent

comments: There is a patch for Vim-like keys: <https://github.com/spcmd/rtorrent-ps/blob/master/vi_keybindings-spcmd.patch>

items.name: htop
items.descr: An interactive system-monitor process-viewer and process-manager.
comments: There is a patch for Vim-like keys: <https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?pid=726353#p726353>
There's also a maintained version of this patch at <https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/htop-vim/>

items.name: btop++
items.descr: A terminal monitor of resources
comments: Setting `vim_keys = True` in config enables minimal Vim controls

items.name: Cypht
items.descr: Web-based email client for multiple accounts.

items.name: Tiny Tiny RSS
items.descr: Web-based news feed (RSS/Atom) reader and aggregator.

items.name: DuckDuckGo
items.descr: An Internet search engine that emphasizes protecting searchers' privacy and avoiding the filter bubble of personalized search results.
comments: Somewhat Vim-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: GitHub
items.descr: An interactive system-monitor process-viewer and process-manager.
comments: Somewhat Vim-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: GMail
items.descr: Google mail.
comments: Somewhat Vim-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: Habr
items.descr: Russian collaborative blog with elements of social network.
comments: Somewhat Vim-like keys are available, but shortcuts do conflict with Vim-like browsers/plugins, which makes them significantly less useful.

items.name: vim-anywhere
items.descr: Spawn a vim buffer from any text input in the operating system.

items.name: ipython
items.descr: Interactive Python shell.
comments:
It no longer uses readline for input, so it must be configured in the ipython profile `~/.ipython/profile_default/ipython_config.py` itself ([reference](https://gist.github.com/sstirlin/c3c207b1052b613ab9554b4ebdfc3f35)):
```ini
c.TerminalInteractiveShell.editing_mode = "vi"
```

items.name: GHCi
items.descr: Interactive Haskell environment.
comments:
It uses [haskeline](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/haskeline) instead of readline. Put this in `~/haskeline`:
```yaml
editMode: Vi
```

items.name: vimpdb
items.descr: An integration of the python debugger `pdb` and vim.

items.name: git
items.descr: Distributed version control of source code.
comments:
Nothing's better than the real deal. Tell git to use vim/nvim when editing commit messages, interactive rebase etc. by putting in your `~/.config/git/config`:
```ini
[user]
    editor = vim
```

items.name: mercurial (hg)
items.descr: Distributed version control of source code.

items.name: aptitude
items.descr: ncurses interface for APT on Debian-derived Linux distros.

items.name: oni2
items.descr: The new onivim project. A text editor drawing inspiration from Sublime, VSCode and Vim.
